bibl.title: Letter from Ida E. Kissinger to James E. Peabody, February 15, 1912

div1.p: Ida Kissinger sends photographs for Peabody's lecture and mentions Kelly's book. The Kissingers appreciate all the help given to them. They also provide Agramonte's address in Havana.

div1.head: Letter from Ida E. Kissinger to James E. Peabody, February 15, 1912
div1.p:
My Dear Sir yours
of the 9th recieved and we surley
are willing to serve you in
any way we can in your
Lecture we were some delayed
we had sent evry picture we
had away at different times and
had to send you one we are
enclosing two of them. One seemed
dim and one is in Civilian Clothes
we havent any Picture of the
building and Mr. Kissinger Says
he doesnt know of any being made
but he has drawn up on three
different sheets so you may get
some Idea as how they were
can be made on blue Print and
Sever as well, he Says its the
Exeact way they were at the
2.
Experiment Camp Mr. Kissinger
says that Dr. Howard Kelly book
covers about evrything and so
you could understand better than
he could explain, at the
Present we do not Know John J.
Moran's address the last we
heard from him he was in
Panama that two years ago
we hear real often from
Dr. H. Kelly and his Sickness
has been a Wassie to us for he
is Certanly a Dear friend of
Cluss we had many hard struggles
and are sure we would have had
none of then if It had not
been for them and other friends
in the East will send you
Dr. Aristides Agramonte address,
Calle K. Eentre 15 Y 17 Vedado
Habana
Cuba.
Thinking it might help you some.
we hope this has not been delayed
to long to be of help to you
and will be pleased to have them
returned as they belong to others
Mr. Kissinger wishes you much
success and says he would
like very much to have one of your
books or any literature which
you might Print of you lectures
div1.closer:
Wishing you success
an Respectfuly Mrs. John R. Kissinger
810 Milton Ave
South Bend
Ind.

div1.head: Infected Clothing Building.
div1.p:
This is where 3 men
slept for 20 nights
on and amidst Infected
Clothing

Drawn by
John R. Kissiger,
South Bend, Indiana

Infected Mosquitoes
turned loose in this
room

There were no
mosquitoes in thes
room

Drawn by John R. Kissiger,
South Bend, Indiana.
